brief_description: Investigating the long-lived immunity and improved protection after skin vaccination
brief_title: Serological Memory and Long-term Protection to Novel H1N1 Influenza Virus After Skin Vaccination
condition_studied: Skin vaccination in BALB/c mice with a single dose of 5 ug inactivated A/California/04/09 virus via coated metal microneedles (MN) applied to skin or via subcutaneous injection
description: Investigating the long-lived immunity and improved protection after skin vaccination
endpoints: the efficacy of a single-dose skin vaccination with inactivated virus using microneedles to elicit robust serological memory and cellular responses
hypothesis: the efficacy of a single-dose skin vaccination with inactivated virus using microneedles to elicit robust serological memory and cellular responses
objectives: the efficacy of a single-dose skin vaccination with inactivated virus using microneedles to elicit robust serological memory and cellular responses
official_title: Serological Memory and Long-term Protection to Novel H1N1 Influenza Virus After Skin Vaccination
